name: Sugar Toasted Almond Spinach Salad
author: M Pineda
summary: This recipe is easy to make, but tastes impressive and is always a big hit at barbecues. You can swap the mandarin oranges for dried cranberries depending on your personal preference.
ingredients: 1 head romaine lettuce, torn into bite sized pieces
directions: Combine almonds and sugar in a small skillet over medium-high heat; cook and stir until sugar is melted over almonds, about 3 minutes
Spread almonds in a single layer on waxed paper to cool
To make the salad dressing, whisk together the vinegar, salad oil, sugar, mustard, poppy seeds, and salt in a bowl; set aside
Toss together the romaine lettuce, spinach, mushrooms, Swiss cheese, onion, and oranges in a large bowl
Sprinkle almonds and drizzle dressing over top of salad just before serving
